column4: ok i really am lost.  wifi is showing as ath0, and in network mgr... i can config ip, but not connecting to network (though it can see all avail SSIDs)
what module are you using?
how can i tell?  :)
lsmod | grep ath
oh - see in Hardware Drivers it's using Atheros HAL
past the output of lsmod | grep ath pls :)
that gives me 4 items... ath_rate_sample, ath_pci, wlan, and ath_hal
does iwlist ath0 scan find anything?
yes, iwlist shows lots
what encryption are you using?
WEP
try to connect with "sudo iwconfig ath0 essid (networkname) key (key) and if you use dhcp than run sudo dhclient afterwards
thanks - that worked!  but why not working in network mgr with same settings?
you're using the gnome-network manager?
i never managed to set a static ip and connect to my wlan with that one  ;)
maybe try some other network manager like wicd owr wifi-radar
maybe it's wrong WEP?  my key is just numbers like: 3109755877
if you entered the same in konsole now it should be the right one
thanks - where can i find other network manager?
i guess wicd and wifi-radar are in the repositories, i personally would recommend wicd, but just try both of them
thanks very much for your attention :)
you're welcome ;)
